hmed.Eltahan@chalhoub.com>; RealEmiratesSupplies <RealEmiratesSupplies@chalhoub.com>; Real Emirates - IT <RealEmirates-IT@chalhoub.com>
Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up
Importance: High

 

Dear Team,

 

Hope my email find you well.

 

Please be informed that SWAROVSKI MOE Popup will open from 28th January until 23rd Feb below is for your action:

 

IT Team @Joseph Diaz <mailto:Joseph.Diaz@chalhoub.com>  @Rizaldy Amada <mailto:Rizaldy.Amada@chalhoub.com>  POS Machine and printer to be arranged.

Store Number : TBC by @Omar <mailto:Omar.Alaridi@chalhoub.com> 

Store Name : 

 

Account Team @Ghouse <mailto:Ghouse.Khan2@chalhoub.com> 

*	Two Credit card machines.
*	2000 AED as float cash.
*	Cash sale will be deposit in Swarovski Boutique MOE every night.

 

Supply Planner @Mohammed Meraj <mailto:Mohammed.Khan@chalhoub.com>  @Yusuf Arikady <mailto:Yusuf.Arikady@chalhoub.com>  to make sure all items are ranged and mapped to the POS once the setup is done.

 

@Omar Alaridi <mailto:Omar.Alaridi@chalhoub.com>  Please to log service request in One reach for the sales team will be support in the Pop Up and share the request ID with IT Team in order to grant the access in POS and SIOCS, additionally, please Advise if normal daily cleaning is required.

 

@Mahmoud Abd Hamid <mailto:Mahmoud.Khedr@chalhoub.com>  @Government Affairs <mailto:Government.Affairs@chalhoub.com>  please to support on License/Permit if needed.

 

@Philip Abdou <mailto:Philip.abdou@chalhoub.com>   Please arrange for the installation of the CCTV system at least one on the top of cash counter.

Gayanka please fill in the CAR insurance form and submit urgently

					 

					Since this pop up is expected to be live from 28th January 2025 to February 23rd 2025, we propose the following as the installation timeline

					 

					*	Night of January 26-27: Pop-up installation, including covering and concealing Swarovski logos and barricading the pop up using mall barricades. Please note, after 1st day installation the outer shell will be complete in all aspects and will look exactly like what the pop up is supposed to loo

					*	Night of January 27-28: Final touches and VM setup

					*	Morning of January 28: Official go-live

					We request you to kindly review and approve the above so we can plan accordingly.

					 

					The following will follow

					1.      Physical material samples for mall approval to be coordinated by my colleague @Umang | ABRA <mailto:umang.s@abravmsd.com>  

					2.      All completed documents as per required mall format to be coordinated by my colleague @Gayanka | ABRA <mailto:gayanka.u@abravmsd.com>  & @Rashmitha | ABRA <mailto:rashmitha.v@abravmsd.com>   . I request you to please share all the requirements so we can submit as required.

					Since this pop up goes live in less than a month's time, we request you to please share your approval on the Technical Drawings at the earliest for us to commence production. 

					 

					 

					
					

					Thanks & Regards

					Tina | Manager – Design | Mob 00971-522653372

					On Thu, Jan 2, 2025 at 2:02 PM Rengucci Stefano <stefano.rengucci@swarovski.com <mailto:stefano.rengucci@swarovski.com> > wrote:

					Dear Noor 

					Thank you for your email

					 

					Our contractor in CC have already shared the drawings

					with you and we are waiting for your approval

					 

					@tina.m@abravmsd.com <mailto:tina.m@abravmsd.com>   @umang.s@abravmsd

					Can you please share again drawings and docs asap with Noor?

					 

					Thank you all

					br

					Stefano

					 

					Inviato da iPhone

					 

					Il giorno 2 gen 2025, alle ore 10:13, Noor Younis <Noor.Younis@maf.ae <mailto:Noor.Younis@maf.ae> > ha scritto:

					﻿ 

					Dear @Rengucci Stefano <mailto:stefano.rengucci@swarovski.com> ,

					 

					Happy New Year! I hope this message finds you well.

					We are still waiting for the consolidated load schedule and the electrical layout for Swarovski’s upcoming pop-up. Please share these at your earliest to ensure a smooth installation process.

chunks.text:
Please share these at your earliest to ensure a smooth installation process. We also require the completed CAR insurance form to be sent back to us for approval.

					 

					For working hours, kindly note the following:

					*	Weekends: 12:00 AM to 8:00 AM
					*	Weekdays: 11:00 PM to 8:00 AM

					In addition, please provide a 3D visual showing the pop-up’s appearance after the first night of the planned two-night installation. This will help us determine whether a hoarding is necessary. If hoarding is required, it will be handled by our team, with the cost covered by the tenant.

					I’ve copied @Abdulrahman Chehabi <mailto:Abdulrahman.Chehabi@maf.ae>  on this email to assist with commercial approval for the two-night installation.

					 

					Looking forward to your prompt response. Let me know if you need further clarification.

					 

					Best regards,

					 

					Noor Younis
					Associate Manager, Retail Delivery
					Tenant Delivery
					
					MAJID AL FUTTAIM PROPERTIES LLC
					Dubai, United Arab Emirates
					T +971 4 206 1711
					M +971 54 993 6602
					Noor.Younis@maf.ae <mailto:Noor.Younis@maf.ae>

					Dear Noor

					Thank you for your email

					We are in the process of finalizing the technical drawings, and our Contractor in CC will soon share the consolidated load schedule and power layout with you.

					In the meantime, could you please confirm the working hour time frame? 

					Our proposed plan is to follow the same approach as the Skims pop-up installation, with the timeline as follows:

					 

					*	Night of January 26-27: Pop-up installation, including covering and concealing our logos

					 

					*	Night of January 27-28: Final touches and VM setup

					 

					*	Morning of January 28: Official go-live

					 

					@tina.m@abravmsd.com <mailto:tina.m@abravmsd.com>   @umang.s@abravmsd.com <mailto:umang.s@abravmsd.com> , could you please share the finalized technical drawings and coordinate a site visit?

					Thank you all for your collaboration.

					Best regards
					Stefano

					 

					Stefano Rengucci
					Architecture project manager 

					Consumer Goods Business

					T +39 338 3570735

					 

					 

					<image008.png>

					 

					
					Swarovski Int.le D'Italia S.r.l - Società a socio unico e soggetta

					Dear @Rengucci Stefano <mailto:stefano.rengucci@swarovski.com>  @Alameddine Bilal <mailto:bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com> ,

					I hope you're doing well.
					I will be overseeing the delivery of the Swarovski X Ariana Grande Podium in MOE. 

					While you finalize the design approvals with my colleague Eman, please prioritize this:

					*	Submit the Electrical Layout and Load Schedule.

					I would like to also inform you that the following will be required prior to the installation:

					1.	Contractor’s All Risk Insurance Payment (0.175% of the contract value plus 5% VAT). 
					Please have your contractor complete Form 16 and return it to us for approval before making the payment.
					2.	Contractor’s valid trade license.
					3.	Method Statement & Risk Assessment 
					4.	Installation Plan.
					5.	Podium Inspection Approval by MAF Retail Design Manager

					Should you have any questions, please feel free to reach out. 

					Thank You
					
					Noor Younis
					Associate Manager, Retail Delivery
					Tenant Delivery

					Hi Stefano

					 

					Good afternoon 

					 

					Thank you for accommodating the comments and meeting the required transparency as per the mall strategy. 

					 

					Please find below link with approved drawings. Kindly note there are few critical comments that needs to be adhered to as per the health and safety of the mall:

					 

					https://mafp.box.com/s/jcha3hibra2fs5z5k71vius4irb9pfjn <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Furl.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com%2Fs%2FXtoVC0XJzfk3pj8SAT5S9a31u%3Fdomain%3Dmafp.box.com&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7C35e3526fc8514740c51208dd3964fc52%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638729828137473811%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=xj2fvRaLQfoXTq3rnyojkPHTpdEJyHCr9D%2F1ur%2BzJqI%3D&reserved=0> 

					 

					*	The platform extent to be aligned with the parameter of bottom of the walls and no portion should be projecting out. Please see below sketch 
					*	The ramps should be inside the walls, aligned with the bottom parameter of the wall.  Please see below sketch 

					 

					<image019.png>

					 

					*	Please consider carpet to be inside only, skirting and ramp to be with solid durable material. To be specified and submitted for approval. 

					 

					In addition, please share the below pending deliverables:

Tannoury <Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae <mailto:Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae> >; Federica Freschet <Federica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					 

 Caution:This email originated from outside the organization. Please do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

					 

					
________________________________


					Dear Eman

					Thank you for your time and cooperation on this urgent project.

					Following our meeting, please find attached the revised layout proposal, updated in line with your specific requests: 

					 

					*	The platform dimensions have been reduced and we have removed all freestanding external elements, such as the popcorn cart
					*	Transparency has been enhanced on all sides by cutting the lateral walls and creating new openings

					 

					Additionally, the CAD drawings are available for your review at the link below:

					https://we.tl/t-JpVnHkli2u <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Furl.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com%2Fs%2F_fwpCgQl4Sq2D8ktvUnS40AO2%3Fdomain%3Dwe.tl&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7C35e3526fc8514740c51208dd3964fc52%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638729828137632163%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=srHDQqCgQ61g4Czgy27B6UAU5lWtHH8YG1VCAnlNVp8%3D&reserved=0> 

					 

					Given our tight schedule, we must commence furniture production on Monday to meet the project deadline

					Hi Emane, 

					 

					Yes, tomorrow 3:00 pm works.

					 

					Best Regards, 

					Bilal

					 

					On 18 Nov 2024, at 3:45 PM, Eman Rahmeh <Eman.Rahmeh-e@maf.ae <mailto:Eman.Rahmeh-e@maf.ae> > wrote:

					﻿ 

					Hi Bilal

					 

					Many thanks for the swift reply. 

					 

					I apologies if the transparency requirement was misunderstood. We have requested for the ceiling opening for visibility and ventilation purposes, but the required transparency along the walls is different and it is a mandate for cross visibility. 

					 

					We understand the branding requirement but it is also important to align the proposal with mall strategy. 

					 

					Let me know if tomorrow 3 pm Dubai time is suitable with you to meet so I can share the meeting link. 

					 

					Thank you. 

					 

					Eman Rahmeh

chunks.text:
ury@maf.ae <mailto:Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae> >; Federica Freschet <Federica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up
					Importance: High

					 

 Caution:This email originated from outside the organization. Please do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

					 

					
________________________________


					Dear Emane,

					 

					I hope this message finds you well. I would like to step in to clarify a few points:

					 

					1.	While we fully understand and appreciate the 60% transparency guideline you discussed, it was clearly mentioned in our last call that the ceiling could be part of this 60%. This is why we have completely removed the ceiling, already compromising our design.
					2.	If we continue to remove elements from the perimeter of the pop-up, we will lose the essence of our concept, and our collaboration's message to the consumer will no longer be valid.
					3.	This design ensures proper cross-visibility with four large openings at each corner.

					 

					We greatly appreciate you considering our comments, design, and the purpose of this pop-up. Reassessing this situation is crucial as it impacts our concept and collaboration.

					 

					Regarding the stanchions and the cart, we will request further enhancements from our creative team. However, please understand that this concept is tied to the release of a specific movie in a cinema. Typically, outside the cinema, F&B is served, and visuals related to the film are displayed. We believe this is the best way to attract people to the pop-up.

We believe this is the best way to attract people to the pop-up. Nonetheless, we will take your comments into consideration and get back to you with possible adjustments from our end.

					 

					Thank you for your understanding and support in facilitating this approval. The timelines are very tight, and we need to confirm our orders and start production as soon as possible; We are surely available for a meeting if this helps us more forward!

					 

					Looking forward to your feedback.

					 

					Best regards,

					 

					Bilal Alameddine
					Head of Retail Architecture, South Europe & CEEMEAN

					OmniChannel and CX Management

					T +971 55 1431766

chunks.text:
ica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >; Alameddine Bilal <bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com <mailto:bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					 

					Dear Stefano

					 

					Good day 

					Thank you for sharing the revised drawings. The pop-up is taking great shape, but the transparency still does not meet the required percentage. Please note that the transparency must be set to 60% within the walls and along the perimeter, rather than within the ceiling, to ensure adequate visibility and cross-visibility in the main corridors of the mall. This is a mandatory requirement in accordance with business direction.

					Additionally, the cart with the stanchions outside the structure is still not fully integrated with the main element. We would appreciate it if the scene outside the capsule could be enhanced to match the level of detail and design present inside.

					Let me know if you would like to discuss this further over a meeting tomorrow.

					 

					Thank you

					Eman Rahmeh
					Associate Manager - Retail Design
					Retail Design & Delivery
					
					PD DESIGN & RETAIL CONSULTANCY FZ LLC
					Dubai, United Arab Emirates
					M +971  52 698 6492
					Eman.Rahmeh-e@maf.ae <mailto:Eman.Rahmeh-e@maf.ae>

chunks.text:
ica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >; Alameddine Bilal <bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com <mailto:bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					 

 Caution:This email originated from outside the organization. Please do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

					 

					
________________________________


					Dear Eman,

					Thank you for your prompt feedback; it is much appreciated.

					 

					Please find attached the revised layout proposal, adjusted to align with your requests. 

					As previously noted, transparent materials are not part of the original concept and, therefore, cannot be incorporated; however we have achieved the required transparency by enlarging the entrances and fully removing the ceiling, which allows for over 60% transparency in the design

					 

					Additionally, we have extended the platform outside the pop-up to accommodate the popcorn cart, securing the area with pink stanchions to enhance visibility as requested.

					 

					A physical samples are currently being prepared.

					The estimated total power consumption is approximately 600W. Upon receiving final design approval, we will proceed with the technical drawings and finalize the electrical load schedule.

					 

					Given our tight timeline to meet the target opening date, it is essential for us to move quickly with furniture production and appoint the general contractor.

					 

					I look forward to your confirmation.

					 

					Best regards

					Stefano

ica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >; Alameddine Bilal <bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com <mailto:bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					 

					Dear Stefano

					 

					Good morning 

					 

					Thank you for providing the necessary information.

					Please note that the materials looks okay however, we would appreciate sharing the physical sample board for review and approval. 

					 

					With regards to the design, we appreciate the consideration to widen the openings and open the ceiling but the mall strategy require 60% transparency which is still not achieved in this design. 

					In addition please note that the cart and pink stanchions cannot be placed on mall flooring, therefore, a raised platform will be needed to accommodate these element. When platform is included, all corners needs to be occupied with 1m long element that integrates with the activation design. 

					 

					Linking the reviewed file with mark-ups for your reference here: https://mafp.box.com/s/fbn6ni2xb3a2qcp3dejnm4gic9hm5x44 <https://eur03.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Furl.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com%2Fs%2F0McCCJ7vwfBYVxXIVDtPSy6X2g%3Fdomain%3Dmafp.box.com&data=05%7C02%7CHagop.Ghazarian%40chalhoub.com%7C35e3526fc8514740c51208dd3964fc52%7C6ef8304cf37b42a5a5690a7d8249fbf3%7C0%7C0%7C638729828138371233%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=d9ZuSUnGplCutrottF4Dz848WLXDMiJMA017rGwgH3o%3D&reserved=0>

Tannoury <Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae <mailto:Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae> >; Federica Freschet <Federica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >
					Subject: Re: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					 

					Hi Eman, 

					 

					Thank you for your time on Monday. 

					 

					Please find attached the updated layout, few points to note: 

					 

					1.	The translucent material is not part of our brand guidelines so unfortunately we cannot include it. However, we have increased the entrance dimensions (both width and height) to enhance transparency.
					2.	The Ariana Grande logo has been removed, leaving only the Swarovski signage as requested.
					3.	The ceiling has been opened to meet ventilation requirements, which also contributes to the overall transparency of the pop-up.
					4.	The external carpet has been removed and will now only be present within the pop-up space.
					5.	Stanchions are a crucial element of our concept and must be retained as part of the VIP entrance to our “Cinema” experience.
					6.	The popcorn machine is also an integral decorative element of our “Cinema” concept. However we have changed the material finishes and it is now integrate in the pop design

					 

					Looking forward to hear back from you. 

					 

					Regards, Marine 

					 

					From: Eman Rahmeh <Eman.Rahmeh-e@maf.ae <mailto:Eman.Rahmeh-e@maf.ae> >
					Date: Friday, 1 November 2024 at 10:39 AM
					To: Marine Fabbricino <Marine.Fabbricino@chalhoub.com <mailto:Marine.Fabbricino@chalhoub.com> >, Priyanka Sharma <Priyanka.Sharma@maf.ae <mailto:Priyanka.Sharma@maf.ae> >, Sofien Brinis <Sofien.Brinis@maf.ae <mailto:Sofien.Brinis@maf.ae> >, Benedicte Blanc <Benedicte.Blanc@chalhoub.com <mailto:Benedicte.Blanc@chalhoub.com> >, Tatiana Karim <Tatiana.Karim@maf.ae <mailto:Tatiana.Karim@maf.ae> >, Abdulrahman Chehabi <Abdulrahman.Chehabi@maf.ae <mailto:Abdulrahman.Chehabi@maf.ae> >

Tannoury <Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae <mailto:Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae> >, Federica Freschet <Federica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
					تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

					Dear All

					 

					Good day 

					 

					It is very exciting to welcome such a unique activation and launch within the mall.

					Overall proposal is interesting however, we would like to discuss few points so the design is in line with the mall design strategy as follows:

					 

					1.	60% Transparency is required at all elevations which can be thru using translucent materials or design wider openings and less solid walls. 
					2.	1x signage ( shop name only ) per elevation should be proposed with max height of 350mm
					3.	Ceiling should be opened from top for ventilation and firefighting system access. 
					4.	Carpet installation directly on mall flooring to be avoided, please clarify why it is needed so maybe a raised platform can be proposed.
					5.	Stanchions to be avoided, please clarify what are they needed for since there is 4 access openings. 
					6.	Cart design should be integrated into the overall design.
					7.	Smell generating machines (popcorn) to be avoided. 
					8.	Consider a statement design on one wall that could be the "hype" and act as an IG area.

We would like to confirm our interest for the following: 

					 

					1.	Unit: TM6-  8X8M 
					2.	Rate: AED 42/ day excluding VAT 
					3.	Dates: Jan 28- Feb14 both dates included. 

					 

					<image119.jpg>

					 

					We understand that the concept is required for approval however Swarovski will only be able to share that in 3 weeks. 

					 

					That said, can we tentatively lock in the dates booking until we can share more details. 

					 

					Thanks and kind regards, 

					 

EMAN AL TAMIMI

Gayanka please fill in the CAR insurance form and submit urgently

					 

					Since this pop up is expected to be live from 28th January 2025 to February 23rd 2025, we propose the following as the installation timeline

					 

					*	Night of January 26-27: Pop-up installation, including covering and concealing Swarovski logos and barricading the pop up using mall barricades. Please note, after 1st day installation the outer shell will be complete in all aspects and will look exactly like what the pop up is supposed to loo

					*	Night of January 27-28: Final touches and VM setup

					*	Morning of January 28: Official go-live

					We request you to kindly review and approve the above so we can plan accordingly.

					 

					The following will follow

					1.      Physical material samples for mall approval to be coordinated by my colleague @Umang | ABRA <mailto:umang.s@abravmsd.com>  

					2.      All completed documents as per required mall format to be coordinated by my colleague @Gayanka | ABRA <mailto:gayanka.u@abravmsd.com>  & @Rashmitha | ABRA <mailto:rashmitha.v@abravmsd.com>   . I request you to please share all the requirements so we can submit as required.

					Since this pop up goes live in less than a month's time, we request you to please share your approval on the Technical Drawings at the earliest for us to commence production. 

					 

					 

					
					

					Thanks & Regards

					Tina | Manager – Design | Mob 00971-522653372

Please share these at your earliest to ensure a smooth installation process. We also require the completed CAR insurance form to be sent back to us for approval.

					 

					For working hours, kindly note the following:

					*	Weekends: 12:00 AM to 8:00 AM
					*	Weekdays: 11:00 PM to 8:00 AM

					In addition, please provide a 3D visual showing the pop-up’s appearance after the first night of the planned two-night installation. This will help us determine whether a hoarding is necessary. If hoarding is required, it will be handled by our team, with the cost covered by the tenant.

					I’ve copied @Abdulrahman Chehabi <mailto:Abdulrahman.Chehabi@maf.ae>  on this email to assist with commercial approval for the two-night installation.

					 

					Looking forward to your prompt response. Let me know if you need further clarification.

ury@maf.ae <mailto:Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae> >; Federica Freschet <Federica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					Dear @Rengucci Stefano <mailto:stefano.rengucci@swarovski.com>  @Alameddine Bilal <mailto:bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com> ,

					I hope you're doing well.
					I will be overseeing the delivery of the Swarovski X Ariana Grande Podium in MOE. 

					While you finalize the design approvals with my colleague Eman, please prioritize this:

					*	Submit the Electrical Layout and Load Schedule.

					I would like to also inform you that the following will be required prior to the installation:

					1.	Contractor’s All Risk Insurance Payment (0.175% of the contract value plus 5% VAT). 
					Please have your contractor complete Form 16 and return it to us for approval before making the payment.
					2.	Contractor’s valid trade license.
					3.	Method Statement & Risk Assessment 
					4.	Installation Plan.
					5.	Podium Inspection Approval by MAF Retail Design Manager

					Should you have any questions, please feel free to reach out. 

					Thank You
					
					Noor Younis
					Associate Manager, Retail Delivery
					Tenant Delivery
					
					MAJID AL FUTTAIM PROPERTIES LLC
					Dubai, United Arab Emirates
					T +971 4 206 1711
					M +971 54 993 6602
					Noor.Younis@maf.ae <mailto:Noor.Younis@maf.ae>

					Thank you for your time and cooperation on this urgent project.

					Following our meeting, please find attached the revised layout proposal, updated in line with your specific requests: 

					 

					*	The platform dimensions have been reduced and we have removed all freestanding external elements, such as the popcorn cart

ury@maf.ae <mailto:Joseph.Tannoury@maf.ae> >; Federica Freschet <Federica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up
					Importance: High

					 

 Caution:This email originated from outside the organization. Please do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

					 

					
________________________________


					Dear Emane,

					 

					I hope this message finds you well. I would like to step in to clarify a few points:

					 

					1.	While we fully understand and appreciate the 60% transparency guideline you discussed, it was clearly mentioned in our last call that the ceiling could be part of this 60%. This is why we have completely removed the ceiling, already compromising our design.
					2.	If we continue to remove elements from the perimeter of the pop-up, we will lose the essence of our concept, and our collaboration's message to the consumer will no longer be valid.
					3.	This design ensures proper cross-visibility with four large openings at each corner.

					 

					We greatly appreciate you considering our comments, design, and the purpose of this pop-up. Reassessing this situation is crucial as it impacts our concept and collaboration.

					 

					Regarding the stanchions and the cart, we will request further enhancements from our creative team. However, please understand that this concept is tied to the release of a specific movie in a cinema. Typically, outside the cinema, F&B is served, and visuals related to the film are displayed. We believe this is the best way to attract people to the pop-up.

We believe this is the best way to attract people to the pop-up. Nonetheless, we will take your comments into consideration and get back to you with possible adjustments from our end.

					 

					Thank you for your understanding and support in facilitating this approval. The timelines are very tight, and we need to confirm our orders and start production as soon as possible; We are surely available for a meeting if this helps us more forward!

					 

					Looking forward to your feedback.

					 

					Best regards,

					 

					Bilal Alameddine
					Head of Retail Architecture, South Europe & CEEMEAN

					OmniChannel and CX Management

					T +971 55 1431766

chunks.text:
ica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >; Alameddine Bilal <bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com <mailto:bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					 

					Dear Stefano

					 

					Good day 

					Thank you for sharing the revised drawings. The pop-up is taking great shape, but the transparency still does not meet the required percentage. Please note that the transparency must be set to 60% within the walls and along the perimeter, rather than within the ceiling, to ensure adequate visibility and cross-visibility in the main corridors of the mall. This is a mandatory requirement in accordance with business direction.

					Additionally, the cart with the stanchions outside the structure is still not fully integrated with the main element. We would appreciate it if the scene outside the capsule could be enhanced to match the level of detail and design present inside.

					Let me know if you would like to discuss this further over a meeting tomorrow.

					 

					Thank you

					Eman Rahmeh
					Associate Manager - Retail Design
					Retail Design & Delivery
					
					PD DESIGN & RETAIL CONSULTANCY FZ LLC
					Dubai, United Arab Emirates
					M +971  52 698 6492

chunks.text:
ica.Freschet@maf.ae <mailto:Federica.Freschet@maf.ae> >; Alameddine Bilal <bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com <mailto:bilal.alameddine@swarovski.com> >
					Subject: RE: Swarovski X Ariana Grande pop up

					 

 Caution:This email originated from outside the organization. Please do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

					 

					
________________________________


					Dear Eman,

					Thank you for your prompt feedback; it is much appreciated.

					 

					Please find attached the revised layout proposal, adjusted to align with your requests. 

					As previously noted, transparent materials are not part of the original concept and, therefore, cannot be incorporated; however we have achieved the required transparency by enlarging the entrances and fully removing the ceiling, which allows for over 60% transparency in the design

					 

					Additionally, we have extended the platform outside the pop-up to accommodate the popcorn cart, securing the area with pink stanchions to enhance visibility as requested.

					 

					A physical samples are currently being prepared.

					The estimated total power consumption is approximately 600W. Upon receiving final design approval, we will proceed with the technical drawings and finalize the electrical load schedule.

					 

					Given our tight timeline to meet the target opening date, it is essential for us to move quickly with furniture production and appoint the general contractor.

					 

					I look forward to your confirmation.

					 

					Best regards

					Stefano
